name: SSF19
title: CS Site-Specific Factor 19
subtitle: Assessment of Positive Ipsilateral Axillary Lymph Nodes
notes: **Note**:  Code the assessment method used for the number of positive axillary and intramammary lymph nodes coded in CS Site-Specific Factor 3, Number of Positive Ipsilateral Level I-II Axillary Lymph Nodes.  Do not code the assessment method used for Level III axillary nodes or internal mammary nodes.
rows: No ipsilateral axillary lymph nodes positive
No nodes examined pathologically: positive nodes on clinical assessment only
No nodes examined pathologically: negative nodes on clinical assessment or no clinical assessment
Positive fine needle aspiration (FNA) only

Positive fine needle aspiration (FNA) 
AND negative lymph node dissection

Positive fine needle aspiration (FNA) 
AND positive lymph node dissection
Positive core biopsy, incisional only
Positive core biopsy, excisional only
Positive core biopsy, type not specified only

Positive core biopsy(ies) (incisional, excisional, NOS)
AND negative lymph node dissection

Positive core biopsy(ies) (incisional, excisional, NOS)
AND positive lymph node dissection

Positive sentinel lymph node biopsy(ies) only 
(no lymph node dissection)

Positive sentinel lymph node biopsy(ies)
AND negative lymph node dissection

Positive sentinel lymph node biopsy(ies)
AND positive lymph node dissection

Positive lymph node dissection only
(No sentinel node biopsy or FNA or core biopsy)

Positive lymph node dissection
AND negative FNA

Positive lymph node dissection
AND negative core biopsy(ies) (incisional, excisional, NOS)

Positive lymph node dissection
AND negative sentinel node biospsy(ies)

OBSOLETE DATA RETAINED V0204
No sentinel node biopsy  
AND positive lymph node dissection
Nodes positive, but method of assessment unknown

Not applicable: Information not collected for this case
